p: In plants, lipids play especially important roles as signaling and energy storage compounds [ 55]. Lipid compounds were identified and analyzed in Lagochilus species by some researchers [ 41, 55, 57]. Laballenic ( 146), octadeca -5,8-dienoic ( 147), eicos -11-enoic ( 148), and eicosa-9,11-dienoic acids ( 149) were detected in L. occultifloris [ 57] ( Table 3, Figure S10). Free and polar lipids from ripe seeds of L. inebrians were investigated by Yuldasheva et al. [ 55], and the findings showed that seeds have a very high percentage of oil content, a large fraction of unsaturated ω-3 and ω-6 fatty acids.
